page.title: 01L'ETACQ TO VAL DE LA MARE
page.content:
This area comprises coastal features, low lying land and marshes, escarpments and land over 250 feet.
Jersey's tourism, agriculture, recreation and craft industries are all represented in this small area and some unique aspects of Island life are to be found here, e.g. the Battle of Flowers Museum.
By far the most notable single enterprise in this area is the States of Jersey's Development of the Parcq des Mielles. This comprises over half the land covered by the D-Block and encompasses the tourism, agriculture recreation and industrial activities of the area.
The following pages illustrate this.
